meanings.definition: To watch over and direct (an undertaking or group of people) in order to ensure a satisfactory outcome.
meanings.sent1: The teacher oversaw the students during the science experiment to make sure they followed the instructions.
meanings.sent2: The manager oversaw the construction project to ensure it was completed on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat oversaw the dog's attempt to bury a bone, looking quite puzzled by the whole process.
meanings.sent4: The eagle oversaw the vast forest below, its keen eyes missing no movement.
meanings.sent5: The security guard oversaw the bustling mall, keeping a close eye on any suspicious activity.

meanings.definition: To supervise or manage (a project or activity) closely.
meanings.sent1: The coach oversaw the team's practice session to improve their skills.
meanings.sent2: The CEO oversaw the company's expansion into new markets.
meanings.sent3: The robot oversaw the assembly line, ensuring each product was perfectly made.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse oversaw the stormy sea, guiding ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The farmer oversaw the planting of the crops, making sure each seed was placed correctly.
